text: Ostvorpommern is a former district in the eastern part of Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania, Germany. The Hanseatic city of Greifswald is surrounded by the district, but does not belong to it. ==History== The district was created on June 12 1994 by joining the old districts of Anklam, Greifswald and Wolgast. == Coat of arms == The coat of arms shows the griffin of Pomerania. ==Towns and municipalities== Amt-free towns Amt-free municipalities #Anklam #Heringsdorf Ämter Ämter Ämter *1.
